newsitem.title: GERMANY: Thyssen down over possible capital rise.
newsitem.headline: Thyssen down over possible capital rise.

text.p: Shares in Thyssen AG fell on Wednesday after the German diversified industrial group said it was studying a possible capital increase.
Thyssen shares fell 14.25 marks to 426.50 marks in post-bourse IBIS computer dealings after earlier reaching a new high at 447 marks. Thyssen had ended bourse trade up 6.50 marks at 442.50 marks.
The broader 30-share DAX index, meanwhile, ended bourse trade up 49.46 points at 4,055.86, a gain of 1.23 percent.

Thyssen said current shareholders would be excluded from the offer, which would be part of the company's portfolio restructuring. Thyssen is in the process of merging its steel operations with Fried. Krupp AG Hoesch-Krupp.
The supervisory board will consider the matter at its July 17 session, Thyssen said. No further information was available.
